greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of binomial(n,k) into distinct parts of the first n rows of Pascal's triangle, 0<=k<=n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..28, flattened
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
mathematica: T[n_] := T[n] = Table[Binomial[m, k], {m, 0, n-1}, {k, 0, m}] // Flatten // Union;
T[n_, k_] /; k <= n/2 := T[n, k] = Select[ IntegerPartitions[ Binomial[n, k], Length[T[n]], T[n]], Length[#] == Length[Union[#]]&] // Length;
Table[Print["T[", n, ",", k, "] = ", T[n, k]]; T[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 02 2020 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 18 2007
